body_html:
Thanks for the change @Lewuathe, but I'd actually prefer to not export these functions.

Users of the API should use the 'op' package to construct the graphs. The functions in util_test.go are there only for unittests of the tensorflow package to avoid any circular dependencies (the 'op' package depends on the 'tensorflow' package and I didn't want the reverse dependency just for unittests).

Let me know if I misunderstood something.

Thanks!
body_text:
Thanks for the change @Lewuathe, but I'd actually prefer to not export these functions.
Users of the API should use the 'op' package to construct the graphs. The functions in util_test.go are there only for unittests of the tensorflow package to avoid any circular dependencies (the 'op' package depends on the 'tensorflow' package and I didn't want the reverse dependency just for unittests).
Let me know if I misunderstood something.
Thanks!
body:
Thanks for the change @Lewuathe, but I'd actually prefer to _not_ export these functions.

Users of the API should use the ['op' package](https://godoc.org/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go/op) to construct the graphs. The functions in `util_test.go` are there only for unittests of the `tensorflow` package to avoid any circular dependencies (the 'op' package depends on the 'tensorflow' package and I didn't want the reverse dependency just for unittests).

Let me know if I misunderstood something.

Thanks!
